answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
A question similar to yours was actually asked earlier this year. You can see the articles and advice others suggested in the link below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/20780/Example_cities_that_have_privatized_trash_pickup 
Looking into your question on my own I found some other items that may help you. One document is a sample of what went into the Village of Lake Bluff, IL’s decision to enter a sanitation collection contract. It includes financial reports, resolutions, ordinances, contracts, and the publications which helped guide them.
http://transformgov.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/document/301665/contracting_municipal_household_waste_collection_services
This second document is similar to the first except it was the research done by the city of Carrollton, Texas. In particular this article discusses the differences between private sector services and their own city’s system.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1568/Talking_Trash_with_the_Private_Sector
I hope this helps your own contract process.
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

text: I would like to hear from jurisidictions that have contracted out sanitation collection.  Success and problems, how long you have had contracts, other points to consider.
title: Cities that have privatized sanitation
